intro: Oxossia annularis, commonly known as the ringed oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves with a ring-like pattern. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Oxossia annularis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
